pullRequest.body:
Co-authored-by: Peter Pfaffelhuber <p.p@stochastik.uni-freiburg.de>

Part of the formalization of the Kolmogorov Extension theorem.

---

nodes.body:
Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7275884318/job/19824560109)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7275884318/job/19824559877)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7275884318/job/19824559375)
I'm not sure why you would need a nonemptyness assumption here: if the product space is empty, then all the measures are zero (by `measure_univ_eq` below), so the conclusion is still true.
No need for nonemptyness here: you can use the empty finset instead of a singleton. Same thing for all other statements in this paragraph.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: projective families of measures and projective limits
